paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the KCNH2 gene and its mutations associated with long QT syndrome, specifically focusing on the G601S and F805C variants.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The temperature-rescued, complex-glycosylated G601S channels were more than fivefold more susceptible to trypsinolysis than their wt counterpart.
The internalized mutants had profoundly accelerated lysosomal transfer kinetics as compared with their wild-type (wt) counterpart.

functional_data.summary: The G601S variant shows accelerated lysosomal degradation and increased susceptibility to proteolysis.

variants.segregation_data: The G601S variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The G601S variant is associated with a loss-of-function phenotype.
key_quotes: The temperature-rescued, complex-glycosylated G601S channels were more than fivefold more susceptible to trypsinolysis than their wt counterpart.
The internalized mutants had profoundly accelerated lysosomal transfer kinetics as compared with their wild-type (wt) counterpart.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Whereas Baf promoted F805C hERG ubiquitination, this was blunted by inhibiting ER-to-Golgi vesicular transport with brefeldin A.
The subcellular redistribution of F805C hERG from lysosomes to the PM was modest but detectable.

functional_data.summary: The F805C variant exhibits severe ER retention and diminished PM expression.

variants.segregation_data: The F805C variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The F805C variant is associated with a loss-of-function phenotype.
key_quotes: Whereas Baf promoted F805C hERG ubiquitination, this was blunted by inhibiting ER-to-Golgi vesicular transport with brefeldin A.
The subcellular redistribution of F805C hERG from lysosomes to the PM was modest but detectable.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding KCNH2 variants were extracted successfully.
